headline: Columbia Sportswear, Under Armour, Carter's, Disney, and Warner Bros. Discovery Stocks Trade Down, What You Need To Know
summary: A number of stocks fell in the afternoon session after stocks gave back some of the gains from the previous day as the White House clarified the tariffs on imports from China would add up to 145%, while the baseline 10% tariffs remained in place for all countries. This reminded markets that the global trade environment remained volatile, limiting the potential for sustained gains.

This reminded markets that the global trade environment remained volatile, limiting the potential for sustained gains.

headline: Nike, Disney, Novavax: Trending Tickers
summary: Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton take a closer look at some of Thursday's trending tickers on Market Domination. Tariff risks weigh on Nike (NKE) as US President Trump increases the tariff on imports from China to 145%. Entertainment stocks like Disney (DIS), Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD), and Fox (FOX, FOXA) are falling after China cut imports of Hollywood content. Novavax (NVAX) stock plunges after US Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. questioned the efficacy of the company's vaccines. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: Disney and Warner Bros. Stocks Are Sinking. China Is Cutting U.S. Film Imports.
summary: The China Film Administration says that the U.S.’s latest tariff decisions has led it to reduce Hollywood film imports.

headline: Oil falls, China tensions weigh on Apple, Disney: Market Minute
summary: Here are some of the stories Wall Street is watching on Thursday, April 10. The ongoing trade battle between the US and China is weighing on shares of Apple (AAPL), Disney (DIS), and Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD). Oil prices (CL=F, BZ=F) are also falling on worries that tariffs could weigh on demand. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Forget the Market Roller Coaster. Theme-Park Stocks Could Be a Tariff Beater
summary: Theme park stocks have sold off hard this year.  Things have been tough for travel and leisure stocks because the economy is weakening and consumer sentiment is persistently sour.  Theme parks have been no exception.

headline: China Limits Hollywood Films as Trade War Escalates to Services
summary: (Bloomberg) -- China announced it would curb imports of Hollywood films, opening a new front in its trade war with the US hours after President Donald Trump’s record tariffs took effect.Authorities vowed to “moderately reduce” the number of US movies allowed into the world’s second-largest economy in a Thursday statement — a step floated earlier this week as a possible retaliation measure by two influential Chinese bloggers. “The wrong action of the US government to abuse tariffs on China will i
